meanings.definition: The state or quality of being integral.
meanings.sent1: The integralities of the project were crucial for its success.
meanings.sent2: She understood the integralities of the math problem after studying it carefully.
meanings.sent3: The integralities of the puzzle made it challenging yet fun to solve.
meanings.sent4: His speech emphasized the integralities of teamwork in achieving goals.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the integralities of a language helps in effective communication.

meanings.definition: The essential or fundamental nature of something.
meanings.sent1: The integralities of friendship include trust and support.
meanings.sent2: He explored the integralities of the ancient artifact to uncover its history.
meanings.sent3: The integralities of a good story are plot twists and character development.
meanings.sent4: Music captures the integralities of emotions that words cannot express.
meanings.sent5: The integralities of a seed are its potential to grow into a plant.

meanings.definition: The completeness or wholeness of a system or structure.
meanings.sent1: The integralities of the design ensured its functionality and aesthetics.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the integralities of a machine is essential for its maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The integralities of a recipe are what make a dish delicious.
meanings.sent4: The integralities of a team involve each member contributing their unique skills.
meanings.sent5: The integralities of a building include its foundation and structural integrity.
